Working with Hyperlinks

The <a> tag defines a hyperlink, which is used to link from one page to another.

Examples:

1. Basic Hyperlink

Visit Google

2. Open in a New Tab

Visit Wikipedia (opens in a new tab)

3. Link to a Specific Section

Jump to Section

4. Link to an Email

Send an Email

5. File Download

Download Sample PDF

Specific Section

You have reached the specific section of this page.

Working with Lists

Lists in HTML

Ordered List

  1. Item 1
  2. Item 2
  3. Item 3

Unordered List

  • Item A
  • Item B
  • Item C

Nested Lists

  • Parent Item 1
    • Child Item 1
    • Child Item 2
  • Parent Item 2
    • Child Item 3
    • Child Item 4

Ordered List in an Unordered List

  • Category 1
    1. Sub-item 1
    2. Sub-item 2
  • Category 2
    1. Sub-item 3
    2. Sub-item 4

Definition List

HTML
HyperText Markup Language
CSS
Cascading Style Sheets
JavaScript
Programming language for the web
